pullRequest.body:
---

<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [db88a5152b](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/21433/commits/db88a5152ba12e19373ffacd04dca9a55ac8d66e)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ ENNReal.rpow_ofNNReal`
`+ Lp_enorm_le`
`+ Nat.cast_toNNReal`
`+ Real.toNNReal_mul`
`+ bar`
`+ coe_enorm_ae_le_eLpNormEssSup`
`+ eLpNorm'_congr_enorm_ae`
`+ eLpNorm'_enorm`
`+ eLpNorm'_mono_enorm_ae`
`+ eLpNormEssSup_le_of_ae_bound'`
`+ eLpNormEssSup_le_of_ae_enorm_bound`
`+ eLpNormEssSup_lt_top_of_ae_enorm_bound`
`+ eLpNormEssSup_mono_enorm_ae`
`+ eLpNorm_congr_enorm_ae`
`+ eLpNorm_enorm`
`+ eLpNorm_le_of_ae_enorm_bound`
`+ eLpNorm_lt_top_iff_lintegral_rpow_enorm_lt_top`
`+ eLpNorm_mono_enorm`
`+ eLpNorm_mono_enorm_ae`
`+ enorm_eq_iff_norm_eq`
`+ enorm_le_of_ae_bound`
`+ enorm_leq_iff_norm_leq`
`- Lp_nnnorm_le`
`- eLpNorm_lt_top_iff_lintegral_rpow_nnnorm_lt_top`
`- nnnorm_le_of_ae_bound`
`- norm_le_of_ae_bound`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>Increase in tech debt: (relative, absolute) = (2.00, 0.02)</summary>

|Current number|Change|Type|
|-:|:-:|:-|
|93|2|disabled deprecation lints|

Current commit [db88a5152b](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/db88a5152ba12e19373ffacd04dca9a55ac8d66e)
Reference commit [a4b60df9d6](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/a4b60df9d68b3a4a34a879dbd5d5d8fd36ce38b9)

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

Next steps (tomorrow or so):
- fix all the fallout in files depending on this one
- if possible, remove the old lemma variants
- check if these lemmas can be easily generalised; if so, do so
- move the helper lemmas to a better place

This PR just has three little sorries remaining:
- in LpSpace.lean: `theorem ENNReal.rpow_ofNNReal {M : ℝ≥0} {P : ℝ} :
  (ENNReal.ofNNReal M).rpow P = ENNReal.ofNNReal (M ^ P) := sorry`
- in SchwartzSpace.lean: `lemma Real.toNNReal_mul (R S : ℝ) : R.toNNReal * S.toNNReal = (R * S).toNNReal := sorry`
- in SchwartzSpace.lean: `lemma Nat.cast_toNNReal (N : ℕ) : (Nat.cast N : ℝ≥0∞).toNNReal = (Nat.cast N : ℝ).toNNReal := sorry`

It's quite possible these are "wrong" statements, and a different strategy is better. In this case, advice is very welcome.

pullRequest.title: chore: change more lemmas to be about enorm instead of nnnorm
